headline: WHAT THEY ARE SAYING: Members of the Congress Applaud President Biden’s State of the Union Address
sentences:
Together, we are Building a Better America.” [Tweet, 3/1/22]
House Majority Leader, Maryland Congressman Steny Hoyer: “In his #SOTU address, @POTUS laid out his vision for #BuildingABetterAmerica that leads the fight for democracy around the world while ensuring that our democracy delivers opportunity at home & grows stronger, safer, & more prosperous in the years ahead.” [Tweet, 3/1/22]
House Democratic Caucus Chair, New York Congressman Hakeem Jeffries: “President Biden and House Democrats are Building a Better America.

We need to help AAPI families get back to work and back on their feet and that is precisely what the President detailed tonight.” [Statement, 3/1/22]
Colorado Congressman Joe Neguse: “Through a global pandemic, economic upheaval, devastating western wildfires and crises at home and abroad, President Biden has never faltered in delivering needed support to the American people and providing leadership and direction in times of great consequence.” [Statement, 3/1/22]
Delaware Congresswoman Lisa Blunt Rochester: “.

#SOTU” [Tweet, 3/1/22]
New Jersey Senator Bob Menendez, Chairman, Senate Foreign Affairs Committee: “Under @POTUS leadership, the transformative bipartisan law that Congress passed is delivering long-overdue investments in our nation’s infrastructure while creating jobs and economic opportunity for communities long overlooked.” [Tweet, 3/1/22]
Ohio Senator Sherrod Brown, Chairman, Senate Banking, Housing and Urban Affairs Committee: “President Biden has united the free world against Russia’s invasion.

Airport will receive $24 million to boost tourism + strengthen our economy while $29 billion is on its way to fund much-needed repairs to CA’s roads + bridges.” [Tweet, 3/1/22]
California Congresswoman Judy Chu, Chairwoman, Congressional Asian American Pacific Caucus (CAPAC): “Tonight, President Biden laid out his vision to build a better America for all of us.

Here’s what they are saying:
Senators
Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer: “Here’s how far we’ve come with President Biden and Dems in Congress: —Fastest economic growth in one year since the 80s —More jobs in one year than in any president’s 1st year on record —COVID cases dropping —Over 215M Americans vaccinated And there’s so much more to do!

These are bipartisan issues we can all agree on.” [Tweet, 3/1/22]
Delaware Senator Tom Carper, Chairman, Senate Environment and Public Works Committee: “We’re rebuilding our nation’s crumbling roads & bridges, upgrading our airports, and removing lead pipes to help all Americans have access to clean drinking water.

#SOTU2022” [Tweet, 3/1/22]
Members of Congress
Speaker of the House, California Congresswoman Nancy Pelosi: “With @POTUS leadership, we will make more goods in America, lower everyday costs of energy, child care, prescription drugs and more, deliver better prices for consumers & create more good-paying union jobs.

@POTUS and @SenateDems are working hard to: —Reduce the costs of everyday expenses —Help small businesses thrive —Create good-paying jobs #SOTU” [Tweet, 3/1/22]
Illinois Senator Tammy Duckworth: “Thanks to President Biden’s Bipartisan Infrastructure Law, we’re done talking about infrastructure *weeks.

#SOTU” [Tweet, 3/1/22]
Ohio Congresswoman Joyce Beatty, Chair, Congressional Black Caucus: “Tonight, President Biden laid out a clear message for every American: We are building a better America, and the state of our union is strong.” #SOTU2022 [Tweet, 3/1/22]
Ohio Congressman Tim Ryan: “$20 billion.

#SOTU [Tweet, 3/1/22]
Michigan Congresswoman Debbie Dingell: “Last night, @POTUS presented a clear vision for #BuildingABetterAmerica, & he showed a deep understanding of the challenges rising costs are causing our neighbors & working families.” [Tweet, 3/2/22]
Nevada Congresswoman Susie Lee: “.

#SOTU” [Tweet, 3/1/22]
Washington Senator Patty Murray, Chair, Senate Health, Education, Labor and Pensions Committee: “It’s good to see @POTUS start the #SOTU strong with steps to hold Russia accountable for its unjustified and unprovoked war of aggression while uniting our global allies.

#SOTU” [Tweet, 3/1/22]
Senate Majority Whip Dick Durbin: “I look forward to working with the President to deliver on his Unity Agenda to combat the opioid crisis that has plagued our country, strengthen mental health resources, support our veterans, and end cancer as we know it.

#SOTU” [Tweet, 3/1/22]
Illinois Congressman Mike Quigley: President Biden’s Infrastructure Investment & Jobs Act will help Illinois fight climate change by investing $4 billion in public transportation and $226 million in bicycle and pedestrian infrastructure.

He did it with the Recovery Act and he’ll do it with pandemic relief.” [Tweet, 3/1/22]
Florida Congresswoman Lois Frankel: “The people of Ukraine are inspiring the world with their bravery & resilience in their fight for the future of democracy.

#SOTU” [Tweet, 3/1/22]
North Carolina Congressman David Price: “@POTUS’ four-point economic plan will reduce everyday costs for American families while stimulating job growth and increasing good paying jobs for workers across the country.

FACTS.” [Tweet, 3/1/22]
House Majority Whip, South Carolina Congressman Jim Clyburn: “As Chair of @COVIDOversight, I can tell you we are in a much better place today than where we were when @POTUS took office.

As Chairman of @VetAffairsDems, I’m committed to that obligation, and @POTUS is, too.” [Tweet, 3/1/22]
California Congresswoman Sara Jacobs: “Over this past year, @POTUS has delivered big for San Diego.
He has called on Congress to send bills to his desk to deliver progress for the American people: to beat the opioid crisis, address mental health, support our veterans, and end cancer as we know it.

We’re starting an infrastructure decade.” [Tweet, 3/1/22]
Maryland Senator Ben Cardin, Chairman, Senate Small Business Committee: “I challenge you to understand prescription drug prices in the US.
He reminded the country that our best days lie ahead, and that his Presidency is about giving everyone a fair shot – because when given half a shot, ordinary people can do extraordinary things.

#SOTU” [Tweet, 3/1/22]
Michigan Senator Debbie Stabenow, Chair, Senate Agriculture, Nutrition and Forestry Committee: “There’s no doubt that MI workers & businesses are the best in the world.

Are you with us?” [Tweet, 3/2/22]
North Carolina Congresswoman Alma Adams: “The American people stand united behind the people of Ukraine and against Putin’s attempts to divide our country.

?#SOTU” [Tweet, 3/1/22]
Maryland Senator Chris Van Hollen: “Thanks in large part to the #AmericanRescuePlan, our nation is now experiencing the fastest economic growth in nearly 40 years.

#SOTU.” [Tweet, 3/1/22]
California Congresswoman Nanette Barragan: “@POTUS is right, the climate, clean energy, & EJ investments in #BuildBackBetter will save the avg family $500 a year!
President Biden has continued to champion diplomacy on the world’s stage and is holding Putin and his corrupt regime accountable for their senseless violence in Ukraine.
The President also announced his unity agenda, consisting of four areas where we have historically been able to come together and find agreement regardless of party.
The President’s economic strategy is an historic shift from the old, outdated trickle-down approach to one that puts workers, families, and small businesses first.

#SOTU” [Tweet, 3/1/22]
California Congressman Jared Huffman: “At tonight’s State of the Union there will be a lot of accomplishments for @POTUS to talk about.

Congress has a critical role to play and I’ll keep looking for ways to support the Ukrainian people.” [Tweet, 3/1/22]
California Senator Alex Padilla: “.
Over the next year, the Biden-Harris Administration will continue working to make communities safer, move forward safely from COVID-19, and lower prices.

#SOTU” [Tweet, 3/1/22]
Texas Congressman Joaquin Castro: “Climate change is one of the biggest threats we face, and it’s accelerating at dangerous speed.
This is especially important for the Asian American and Pacific Islander (AAPI) communities that have been disproportionately impacted by the pandemic.

We must #LowerDrugPrices now.” [Tweet, 3/1/22]
New York Congressman Mondaire Jones: “Last night, @POTUS laid out his plan to build a better America.

#ActOnClimate #SOTU.” [Tweet, 3/1/22]
California Congressman Mark Takano: “We have a sacred obligation to deliver veterans the care they’ve earned.

#SOTU” [Tweet, 3/1/22]
Pennsylvania Senator Bob Casey: “Our economy has added an earth-shattering 7.1 million jobs since @POTUS took office.
I’ve been studying them for years and I don’t understand why the US pays more for prescription drugs than other industrialized nations.
In his first State of the Union, the President spoke directly to the American people about his vision to build a better America.

#SOTU2022” [Tweet, 3/1/22]
Massachusetts Congressman Jim McGovern, Chairman, House Rules Committee: “American diplomacy matters.
Investments in clean energy help Nevada by protecting our environment and helping to conserve our treasured public lands.
@POTUS said it best: “freedom will always triumph over tyranny,” & we will support them against Russian aggression.
That’s why I worked with @POTUS to include my Make It in America Act in the Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act!

#SOTU” [Tweet, 3/1/22]
Nevada Senator Jacky Rosen: “Thank you @POTUS for your commitment to a clean energy future.
Higher wages, affordable child care for every family, lower prescription drug costs, and environmental justice.
A reminder of what’s possible when we have the guts to take on China by investing in our workers here at home.
Congress worked with President Biden to make a once-in-a-generation investment in the Nation’s infrastructure.
From Winter Storm Uri to Hurricane Harvey, Texans known the devastating impacts of climate change firsthand.
Thanks @GND_Network for showing up with me tonight to send the message that #climateaction is #PastDue.
Add to that reducing dependance on Russian oil, union jobs, less air pollution, & bold climate action.
@POTUS provided free masks, free tests and more resources to help protect Americans from COVID-19.
Tonight, members of both parties are standing together in solidarity with the people of Ukraine.
@POTUS knows what he’s talking about when it comes to cracking down on fraud and abuse.
This makes sure our tax dollars are spent on American products & American jobs.
Seniors going hungry in order to cover the costs of life-saving medications.
This was critical to help people stay safe and more help is on the way.
But when it comes to the State of our Climate, we’ve got work to do.
Recent updates to public health recommendations reflect our success.
Not to mention, a faster recovery than any other advanced economy.
Under @POTUS’ leadership, vaccinations are up and cases are down.
@POTUS is right — we need to lower your costs, not your wages.
We’re putting money back in hardworking Americans’ pockets.
As long as we stand together, dictators will never prevail.

#SOTU” [Tweet, 3/1/22]
Texas Congressman Colin Allred: “.
+ millions of dollars more that will be felt across Ohio.
Through the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law, San Diego Int.
America is leading the world in its economic recovery.

#SOTU” [Tweet, 3/1/22]
Hawaii Senator Mazie Hirono: “.
Members of Congress praised the President’s remarks.
Like @POTUS said, enough with infrastructure week.
I stand with @POTUS and my Democratic colleagues.
* We’re heading for an infrastructure *decade.*?
Thank you President Biden for your leadership.
I am so glad he is president in this moment.
7,000 good-paying, union construction jobs.
Glad to see @POTUS’s commitment to this.
3,000 good-paying manufacturing jobs.
Diabetics who can’t afford insulin.
I hear it all too often.
#SOTU” [Tweet, 3/1/22]
It’s heartbreaking.
@POTUS is right.
It’s historic.
I’m all in.
